status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
Dump external network usage of instances from iptables rules to a file, which will be read by getstats.pl (invoked by NC code).
With the removal of Managed and Managed-NOVLAN modes, CC does not have network information about instances.
fields.summary: eucanetd: EDGE: generate external network statistics

comments.body:
Changes in eucanetd (to periodically generate external network statistics and dump to a file in EUCA_RUN_DIR), and in NC code (to read the external network statistics file and update its sensor cache). In the deprecated/removed MANAGED/MANAGED-NOVLAN modes, tools/getstats_net.pl, invoked by CC, was responsible to compute the external network statistics from iptables counters. tools/getstats_net.pl was removed, and tools/getstats.pl includes the external network statistics (computed by eucanetd).
This only affects EDGE (but regression tests for both EDGE and VPCMIDO are needed due to changes in NC code).
Partially addresses EUCA-10788 - external network is now reported in EDGE mode. Net total is read from libvirt, and seems to be counting all packets (including broadcasts, ARP, etc that are dropped by the guest). External net is derived from iptables counters and includes public network packets delivered to instances (i.e., not dropped by security group rules). Accuracy of the counters are not covered in this ticket.

Verified stats present, and getstats.pl functions:

{code}
[root@e-17 eucalyptus]# ./getstats.pl 
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185019	CPUUtilization	summation	default	38050
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185118	NetworkIn	summation	total	124421102
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185118	NetworkOut	summation	total	67819
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskReadOps	summation	vda	30500
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskWriteOps	summation	vda	7860
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskReadBytes	summation	vda	231506944
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskWriteBytes	summation	vda	61117440
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeTotalReadTime	summation	vda	1.447
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeTotalWriteTime	summation	vda	62.272
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeQueueLength	latest	vda	0
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskReadOps	summation	vdb	606
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskWriteOps	summation	vdb	28966
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskReadBytes	summation	vdb	2704896
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	DiskWriteBytes	summation	vdb	118636544
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeTotalReadTime	summation	vdb	0.012
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeTotalWriteTime	summation	vdb	4005.692
i-6a8d83ae	1486102185015	VolumeQueueLength	latest	vdb	0
[root@e-17 eucalyptus]# 


{code}



I was able to find an interval, or maybe correct unit type to measure the actual data for an instance. 
Below shows interface stats as reported by the guest vs the stats provided in eucanetd_getstats_net.out for a given interval. I was never able to show similar values with knowing the interval(s) to use, unit type, etc.. 

{code}

In [62]: node = tc.sysadmin.get_hosts_for_node_controllers(instanceid=ins.id)[0]

In [63]: def get_nc_stats():       
    net_in, net_out = node.sys('cat /var/run/eucalyptus/net/eucanetd_getstats_net.out')
    x,incnt,x,x,x,indef = net_in.split('\t')
    x,outcnt,x,x,x,outdef = net_out.split('\t')
    return float(incnt), float(indef), float(outcnt), float(outdef)

In [64]: def get_deltas(time_wait):
    incnt, indef, outcnt, outdef = get_nc_stats()
    ins.show_network_interfaces_delta()
    time.sleep(time_wait)
    incnt2, indef2, outcnt2, outdef2 = get_nc_stats()
    print('in elapsed sec:{0}, in_def_delta:{1}, out elapsed sec:{2}, out_def_delta:{3}'
            .format((incnt2-incnt)/1000, indef2-indef, (outcnt2-outcnt)/1000, outdef2-outdef))
    ins.show_network_interfaces_delta()
   ....:     

In [65]: get_deltas(120)
[2017-02-02 22:25:35,147][DEBUG][10.111.1.208:(['NC'])]: [root@10.111.1.208]# cat /var/run/eucalyptus/net/eucanetd_getstats_net.out
[2017-02-02 22:25:35,315][DEBUG][10.111.1.208:(['NC'])]:
